modes.description: 4K PSSR at a locked 30fps/40fps for 60 Hz/120 Hz screens, or mid 50s with VRR. Highest quality RT (based off Spider-Man 2).

modes.name: performance pro
modes.description: 1440p to 4K PSSR at a locked 60fps, or around 70fps with VRR. Base PS5 level of RT quality (based off Spider-Man 2).

extraInfo: The above information from Spider-Man 2 (Insomniac's most recent game) provides a good baseline of expectations. However, Wolverine should surpass Spider-Man 2 by a wide margin, as it will almost certainly use PSSR 2.0, which is based off the excellent FSR4. Spider-Man was also held back by an open-world originally designed around the PS4. The September 2025 State of Play demo was (likely) running at the 30fps quality mode, which had an internal resolution of 1440p in gameplay and 15120p-1600p in cutscenes, with RT reflections, but not RT shadows. DF themselves say there's a lot of continuity from Spider-Man 2, but already noticeable upgrades in aspects like facial models. We'll hopefully get even more information at the promised info update in spring 2026.

name: World Of Warships: L
extraInfo: Pro runs at 4K/60fps, which is the same as the Series X version. Base PS5 only runs at 1440p/60fps, which means a 2.25x increase in resolution for Pro. There's also an RT toggle for hardware-based reflections on both Pro and base PS5, but the framerate is then capped at a locked 30fps.

name: Wreckreation
extraInfo: Pro has a singular mode than is native 4K at 60fps. It combines the best of base PS5's native 4K/30fps quality mode (with visual enhancements such as improved grass quality) and upscaled 4K/60fps performance mode.

name: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers
rtTypes: Unreal Engine 5 Lumen global illumination and reflections

modes.name: prioritize graphics
modes.description: 900p-1188p DRS to 4K TSR at a basically locked 60fps, or around 80fps with VRR.

modes.name: balanced
modes.description: 810p to 4K TSR at unlocked/70fps on 60 HZ/120 Hz screens, or around 85fps with VRR.

modes.name: prioritize FPS
modes.description: 540p-864p DRS to 4K TSR at 60fps/80fps on 60 HZ/120 HZ screens or around 90fps with VRR. Slightly worse ambient occlusion/pop-in/shadows/textures/draw distance etc compared to other modes.

extraInfo: All modes use Lumen GI/reflections. Pro and base PS5 have the same graphical settings and DRS in their equivalent modes - it's the target framerate that differs. E.g, graphics mode is 900p-1188p on both consoles, but Pro targets 60fps whereas base PS5 targets 30fps. Pro also maintains the higher DRS bound more often. FPS mode can fall out of the VRR range on base PS5 and hitch with sudden resolutions changes/autosaves, whereas Pro aims for as high as 80fps on 120 HZ TVs, with no hitches. 540p can result in extreme artifacting regardless of console. Finally, base PS5 aims for 30/40fps in its graphics/balanced modes, and both are unevenly paced. This make FPS mode the only viable option on base PS5 for smooth gameplay, whereas all 3 modes are viable on Pro.

name: Yakuza 0 Director's Cut
extraInfo: The Director's Cut has a noticeable resolution increase over the 1080p/60fps PS4 edition from 2015/17 and provides a very 4K-like image (the internal resolution could potentially be slightly lower). There is also improved graphical settings like textures/GI etc. However, these changes are less noticeable in general gameplay as opposed to direct comparisons. The real selling point is the additional localizations, cutscenes and Red Light Raid mode etc.

name: Yakuza Kiwami 3 & DT
extraInfo: *All tech information is based off of the demo and is subject to change for the final release (although unlikely given analysis is in line with previous IP entries)  - 'Both Pro and base PS5 run at a very stable 60fps. However, Pro renders a noticeably higher, more 4K-like resolution. This is best seen in the first second of DT's gameplay, where railings/window panes/street markings etc are much more stable in the mid-far distance on Pro. Alpha effects during combat are also less pixelated on Pro.'

name: Zenless Zone Zero
extraInfo: Pro renders at native 4K, with a relatively stable 60fps. At times when the framerate dips under, it's still around 10fps higher than base PS5 (which upscales to 4K). Pro also introduces RT reflections, adds ambient occlusion between objects, and improves diffuse lighting. You can however toggle RT off for a much more locked 60fps.

name: Zombie Derby
extraInfo: While both base PS5 and Pro run at a basically locked 120fps, base PS5 is limited to 1440p. Pro renders at 4K, which is a 2.25x increase in resolution.

name: Zombie Derby 2
extraInfo: While both base PS5 and Pro run at a basically locked 120fps, base PS5 is limited to 1440p. Pro renders at 4K, which is a 2.25x increase in resolution.

name: Zombie Derby: PS
extraInfo: While both base PS5 and Pro run at a basically locked 120fps, base PS5 is limited to 1440p. Pro renders at 4K, which is a 2.25x increase in resolution.
